ğ“„™ ğ“…“ ğ“ƒ˜ | ass/donkey | ğ’„¿ğ’ˆ¨ğ’Š’ 	á¶œi-me-ru â‡” equipe ğ“‚‹ ğ“ƒ— -c-b equipe, cheval ğ“¡ ğ“„¿ ğ“ƒ€ ğ“² ğ“˜ ğ“‡‹ ğ“†± [[chariot]]  



ğ“ƒ˜ â‡” Sumerian kungas, hybrids of domesticated donkeys and Syrian wild asses. War donkeys  

https://www.guardianmag.press/2022/01/hybrid-animal-in-4500-year-old-tomb-is-earliest-known-bred-by-humans.html/  
kungas highly prized and very expensive beasts, which could be explained by the rather difficult process of breeding them  

![](https://www.guardianmag.press/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/war.jpg)  

Kungas are mentioned in several ancient texts in cuneiform on clay tablets from Mesopotamia, and they are portrayed drawing four-wheeled war wagons on the famous â€œStandard of Ur,â€ a Sumerian mosaic from about 4,500 years ago  

![](https://www.worldhistory.org/uploads/images/8427.jpg?v=1521623295)  

The Syrian wild ass species had become much smaller in recent times than it had been in antiquity, probably due to environmental pressures such as hunting; it is now extinct.

ğ“ƒ˜ hemippe hemi - hippo (half horse)  
ğ“ƒ˜ achdari
